page.title: 15Tourism
page.content: The area is excellent for tourism, catering for many interests. Historically it is very important and has several buildings of great interest. For the more energetic the hilly areas are suitable for walking, climbing, orienteering, pony-riding, and for forces training. There are several lakes, the largest of which, Llyn Geirionydd, now 'dead' because of pollution, is used for sailing, wind surfing, power boating, scuba diving, and canoeing. There is a picnic area and car parking facilities. Fishing is available in Glan Gors and on the river Conwy on a fee paying basis. The Forestry Commission mounts exhibitions about their work and maintain and sign post walks through Gwydyr Forest. There is accommodation in good hotels, boarding houses, bed & breakfast, and caravan and chalet sites.
